means: [人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 格拉斯地貌名称，来源于中世纪英语或德语，含义是“草地，草原，牧场”(grass,pasture,grazing)
[人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 格拉斯绰号，粗壮的人，来源于盎格鲁诺曼底法语，含义是“肥胖”(fat)
[人名] [苏格兰人姓氏] 格拉斯职业名称，来源于盖尔语，含义是“鞋匠”(shoemaker)

geographic resources analysis support system 地理资源分析支持系统
ground-to-air scanner surveillance 地空扫描监视
grass ： 指一般的青草或牧草。
herb ： 指可供药用或生产食物调料用的草。
weed ： 指混在作物中的杂草或园中的野草。

word_mean: 草：禾本科植物。下列各草的花粉为引起枯草热的主要过敏原：狗牙草(Cynodon dac-tylon)，六月草(poa pratensis)，石茅(Sorghum halepense)，鸭茅(Dactylis glomerata)，红顶草(Agrostis alba)，甜春草(Anthoxanthum odoratum)，梯牧草(phleum pratense)

encyclopedia.content: GRASS简介基本简介 全称Geographic Resources Analysis Support System,是一款基于GNU GPL协议的开源地理信息系统软件，具有空间数据管理与分析，图像处理，数字制图，空间建模和可视化等功能。GRASS现已被许多政府机构、大学和环境咨询公司所使用。发展历史 GRASS的开发工作可以追溯到1982年，当时美国联邦政府联合相关大学和几家私人公司参与了GRASS的最初开发。最后美国军方实验室在前几家的基础上开发了GRASS的核心部分，并在

entry.def: Grass is a very common plant consisting of large numbers of thin, spiky, green leaves that cover the surface of the ground.

example.ex: Small things stirred in the grass around the tent...
example.tran: 一些小东西在帐篷四周的草丛里窸窸窣窣地动着。

example.ex: The lawn contained a mixture of grasses.
example.tran: 草坪上生长着各种青草。

entry.def: If you talk about the grass, you are referring to an area of ground that is covered with grass, for example in your garden.

example.ex: In the old days, there were strict fines for walking on the grass or missing a study period...
example.tran: 过去，踩踏草坪或旷课都会被重金处罚。

example.ex: I'm going to cut the grass.

entry.def: Grass is the same as marijuana .

example.ex: I started smoking grass when I was about sixteen.
example.tran: 我大约16岁的时候开始吸大麻。

entry.def: If you say that one person grasses on another, the first person tells the police or other authorities about something criminal or wrong which the second person has done.

example.ex: His wife wants him to grass on the members of his own gang...
example.tran: 妻子要他向警方告发他所在团伙的成员。

example.ex: He was repeatedly attacked by other inmates, who accused him of grassing.
example.tran: 他屡遭指责他告密的其他囚犯的殴打。

entry.def: A grass is someone who tells the police or other authorities about criminal activities that they know about.

entry.tran: 草是那边绿；这山望着那山高
entry.def: If you say the grass is greener somewhere else, you mean that other people's situations always seem better or more attractive than your own, but may not really be so.

example.ex: He was very happy with us but wanted to see if the grass was greener elsewhere.
example.tran: 他对我们感到十分满意，但还想看看是否有更合适的人选。

entry.def: If you say that someone is being put out to grass, you mean they are no longer being employed because they are considered to be too old or no longer useful.

example.ex: The Prime Minister refused to be put out to grass. Asked if he would quit, he replied: 'The answer is No'.
example.tran: 首相拒绝被解除职务，当问到他是否会辞职时，他说，“我的回答是不。”
